ack.title: Acknowledgements
ack.p: The field research was conducted under foreign research permits issued by the Indonesian State Ministry of Research and Technology (Permit Numbers: 3/TKPIPA/FRP/SM/III/2013 and 154/SIP/FRP/E5/Dit.KI/VII/2017) and was carried out in collaboration with scientific counterpart organisation Pusat Penelitian Arkeologi Nasional (ARKENAS). SEM analyses were conducted at the Queensland University of Technology’s Central Analytical Research Facility. Powder diffraction was undertaken on the beam line at the Australian Synchrotron, which is part of the Australian Nuclear Science and Technology Organisation. The research was funded by Australian Research Council (ARC) fellowships awarded to M.A. (FT170100025) and A.B. (FT160100119), with further financial support from Griffith University. We thank Zhihong Xu former director of Griffith’s Environmental Futures Research Institute and Susan Forde director of the Griffith Centre for Social and Cultural Research for financial support. J.H.’s participation supported in part by ARC Laureate Grant FL160100123. We thank Tim Maloney (Griffith Centre for Social and Cultural Research) for assistance with radiocarbon calibration and Laura Jacobs (Université Laval) for assistance with sample preparation for Synchrotron Powder Diffraction undertaken during her internship in Rock Art Conservation with JH. We also thank Zhihong Xu (former director of Griffith's Environmental Futures Research Institute) for financial support.
